RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Engenharia de Pesca pela Universidade Federal Rural de Pernambuco (1979), mestrado em Oceanografia pela Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (1988) e doutorado em Ecologia e Recursos Naturais pela Universidade Federal de São Carlos (1996). Atualmente é professor associado IV do Centro de Ciências Biológicas da UFPE. Tem experiência na área de Recursos Pesqueiros e Engenharia de Pesca, com ênfase em aqüicultura, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Piscicultura ornamental, Carcinicultura marinha e de água doce, Nutrição, Policultivo e Aclimatação.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Engenharia de Pesca from Universidade Federal Rural de Pernambuco (1979), master's at Biological Oceanografy from Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (1988) and doctorate at Ecology from Universidade Federal de São Carlos (1996). Has experience in Fishery Resources and Fisheries Engineering, focusing on Fishery Resources and Fisheries Engineering, acting on the following subjects: litopenaeus vannamei, peixes ornamentais, polyculture, 2.pos-larvas and 2.nutricao.

DOCENTE
Professor da disciplina Zoologia dos invertebrados superiores (crustáceos - Bacharelado); Zoologia dos invertebrados superiores (crustáceos - Licenciatura);e em pós-graduação as seguintes: Maricultura; cultivo de crustáceos;Piscicultura; Biologia dos Vertebrados

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Aclimatação de juvenis de Penaeus vannamei Boone, 1931 à água doce

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Aquicultura Brasil98

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Racoes a base de refugos de cevada e pipoca para alimentacao de pos-larvas de Macrobrachium rosenbergii De Man, 1879 em bercario

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI congresso Brasileiro de Engenharia de Pesca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Eigt diets were used in order to test the growth rate of Macrobrachium rosenbergii post-larvae of the prawn. The rations were made according to ingredients availability and costs. Barley and popcorn residuals fitted best this purpose. It was tesed the following proportions: 0.0 and 0.0 R-1, 19.0 and 0.0 R-2, 15.5 and 3.5 R-3, 12.5 and 6.5 R-4, 9.5 and 9.5 R-5, 6.5 and 12.5 R-6, 3.5 and 15.5 R-7,0.0 and 19.0 R-8. The diet pellet stability were tested in freshwater during 30, 60, 120, 240, and 360 minutes. The post-larvae PL growth study carried out in 16 aquaria of 50L each, equiped with a biologiucal filtration system. The same diet was used to each two aquaria. The population density was 20PL/0.125m2, job 12 of body weight, three times a day of the prawn total biuomass. The water physico-chemical parameters were daily measured and the biometry each two weeks. In relation to the post-larval growth rate all diets were feasible, being R-1, R-3, R-5 and R-8 the best ones presenting the prawns a final average weight over 0.65g during 59 days of cultivation. IT was observed that the lack of barley an popcorn residuals R-1, or the higher concentration of one of these ingredients R-3 and R-8 were responsable for the better growth rate. Statisticaly, the treatments R-4 and R-8 presented, the worse and the best growth P<0.05 respectively.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Cultivo de Litopenaeus vannamei em agua doce.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Congresso Brasileiro de Engenharia de Pesca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The subject of this paper was to culture Litopenaeus vannamei in freshwater. This experiment was carried out at Aquaculture Laboratory of Federal University of Pernambuco. Weekly, the pH, oxygen dissolved, temperature and total hardness of water was measured and a feed offered was made by Purina for shrimps. During the period do 112 days, the shrimp were cultured in tanks 1.5 m2 with three total densities 10PLs/m2, 15PLs/m2 and 20 Pls/m2. The densities were not significantly different among treatments. Mean final weight and body lenght was 8.5g and 10.0cm, respectively. The survival among treatments was from 66.6 to 73.3.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Policultivo do camarao Macrobrachium jelskii Miers, 1877 Chace e Holthuis, 1948 com peixe ornamental Carassius auratus Gunther, 1870.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Congresso Brasileiro de Engenharia de Pesca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This subject was this paper was evaluates the influence provoked by the foraging prawn Macrobrachium jelskii in a ornamental fish Carassius auratus polyculture. This experiment was carried out at Aquaculture Laboratory of Federal univaersity of Pernambuco. Daily, the pH, oxygen dissolved and the temprature were monitored and feed was offered 3 ratio from the total fish biomass. The biometry was made each 15 days. The experiment was conduced in two treatments with one repetition each. The density of treatment one T1 and T2 was 100 fingerlings of C. auratus with 100 prawns and the density of treatment two T3 and T4 was 100 fingerlings of C. auratus only. The temprature was 25 to 28oC, pH 7.0 to 7.7 and the dissolved oxygen 7.0 to 7.8mg/L, with non-stop aeration. The final average size and the survival were of 6.6cm and 64.5 and 5.0cm and 56 respectively for Carassius auratus.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Policultivo de camarao de agua doce Macrobrachium rosenbergii De Man com o peixe oramental Xiphophorus helleri Heckel em tanques bercarios

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Congresso Brasileiro de Engenharia de pesca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper cultured post-larval of the prawn Macrobrachium rosenbergii with the ornamental fish Xiphophorus helleri in nursery. Tests were made from may 6 to july 6 of 1998. In the experiment were used two tanks T1 and T2 with 1.5m2 each. The tank 1 was populated with 100 post-larval of M. rosenbergii and 70 fingerlings of X. helleri, being tank 2 used for repetition. Every other 15 days all the post-larval and the fingerlings were caught for the realization of biometries. The tanks showed temperature varying between 25 and 28oC, pH 7.0, with non-stop aeration and daily ration equal to 12 of the prawn biomass. The final average size and survival were 5.4cm and 65, 5.0cm and 63 respectively for M. rosenbergii and X. helleri.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Policultivo de pos-larvas de Macrobrachium rosenbergii com alevinos de peixes ornamentais Melanotaenia sp. em bercario

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Congresso Brasileiro de engenharia de pesca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper studied the polyculture fo the prawn Macrobrachium rosenbergii with the ornamental fish Melanotaenia sp. in tanks of 1.50m2. This work was conduced in a period of 70 days 04/01/98 to 06/10/98 in aquaculture Laboaratory of Federal University of Pernambuco. Daily, the pH, oxygen dissolved, and the temperature of water was monitored and feed was offered 6 ratio rom the total biomass. The biometry was each 15 days. The experiment was conduced in one treatment with one repetition. The tanks 1 and 2 were culture with 100 Pls/1.5m2 of prawns and 50 Melanotaenia sp. fishes in each one. The most medial growth of prawns was 4.47cm in tank 1 and of fishes was 4.22cm in tank 2. the medial survival of prawns was 78 and of fishes was 95. The results showed that this polyculture can be used by fishfarms or prawnfarms like a new profit source.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Policultivo intensivo dos peixes ornamentais Molinesia velifera e Barbo conchonius com o camarao forrageiro Macrobrachium jelskii

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Congresso Brasileiro de Engenharia de Pesca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The polyculture was carried out in the Aquaculture Laboratory of the Federal University of Pernambuco, Brazil, from 04/15 to 06/30/1998. The objective of this work was to verify the polyculture viability of ornamental fishes Molinesia velifera and Barbus conchonius with the forage prawn Macrobrachium jelskii. Two tanks were used with 1.54x1.00x0.50m3 dimensions being the second tank a repetition of tank 1. In both tanks it was cultivated 100 B. conchonius, 95 M.velifera and 50 M. jelskii. Daily the pH, dissolved oxygen and the temperature were monitored and the feed was offered in the proportion of 3 of the total fish biomass. A ration was prepared in the Aquaculture Laboratory and was consisting of500g of oyster, 100g of fish, 200g of soya bean, 500g of liver, one cooked egg, 200g corn flour, 1 of salt and 3 of oil. The biometry was made each 15 days. At the end of seventy five days culture the mean survival was 89.5 for the B. conchonius, 79.5 for the M. velifera and 18.5 for the M. jelskii. This last one low survival and the lack of the shrimp post-larvae PL in the end of experiment probably indicated the good aception of the shrimp larvae by the fishes as food. The results showed that in the culture of M. velifera and B. conchonius the influence of M. jelskii is favorable.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Policultivo dos peixes ornamentais Pterophyllum scalare Heckel, 1840 e Poecilia reticulata Peters, 1859 com camarao de agua doce Macrobrachium rosenbergii.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Congresso Brasileiro de Engenharia de Pesca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paer presents the influence of the forage prawn Macrobrachium jelskii in a polyculture with the ornamental fishes Pterophyllum scalare and Poecilia reticulata. The experiment was conduced for 2 months 05/14 to 07/14/1998in two concrete tanks with 1.5m2 each, at the Aquaculture Laboratory fo the Federal University of Penambuco, Brazil. The feeding was offered two times a day, utilizing 3 from total fish biomass. The hydrological measurements: pH, temperature and dissolved oxygen were made daily. The results showed that in this polyculture with P. scalare and P. reticulata the influence of M. jelskii was favorable and the gross profit U 29.38/1.5m2/2 months showed that this culture can be used by fishfarmers.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Viabilidade da reversao sexual na criacao de Guppy Poecilia reticulata Peters, 1859

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XI Congresso Brasileiro de Engenharia de Pesca

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This experiment was carried out at the Laboratory of Aquaculture of UFPE, when it was observed the economical viability of sexual reversion in guppy, Poecilia reticulata, by adding 17 alfa Metil-Testosterona MT to the ration. It was used 600 fishes, from 1 to 3 days of life, distributed for 9 treatments 3 fold and 3 control groups. It was tested the use of 3 different concentrations of MT: 20, 25 and 30 mg for Kg of ration, for 20, 30 and 40 days. The sex differentiation was made by observation of gonopodio, a male characteristic in this specie. Using this technic, it was reversed to male all specimens in treated groups. The treated animals had a lower sexual differentiation time than control specimens. After 90 days there were no statistical differentiation in average lenght of body and average lenght of the tail fin between treated and control animals. For the considerations above, the low of ration cost, and the reduced mortality taxa 7, the technic worked in this experiment can be considered as economically viable.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: PRELIMINARY OBSERVATIONS ON THE LARVAL CYCLE OF ARROW CRAB Stenorhynchus seticornis (HERBST, 1788) (DECAPODA: BRACHYURA: MAJIDAE) IN LABORATORY.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Pesca, Aqüicultura e Atividades dos Serviços Relacionados Com Estas Atividades

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
ABSTRACT
The aim of this work was close the larval cycle of Stenorhyncus seticornis using techniques developed for commercial prawn Macrobrachium rosenbergii. The Stenorhyncus seticornis larvae came from a spawn in aquarium in Aquaculture Laboratory of the Federal University of Pernambuco. Fifty larvae were transferred to a circular vessel with two liters of water in the same conditions of spawn. Means value for water quality parameters were: 28.7oC for temperature, 6.7 ml/L oxygen, 35.1 ? salinity, 8.4 pH and 0.01ml/L ammonium. The larvae were fed ad libitum with chopped fish and nauplius of Artemia sp. three times a day. The first megalopa ocurred after ten days and 50% of survivors passed to megalopa stage after twelve days. The final survival was 30%. The present findings demonstrate that this crab may be cultured using standard techniques developed for commercial prawn Macrobrachium rosenbergii industry and this species potential to ornamental aquaculture.
Key words: Sternorynchus seticornis, Majidae, larvae culture, marine ornamental, aquarium.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Cultivo de pós-larvas de Macrobrachium rosenbergii (De Man, 1879) com os alevinos de Pterophyllum scalare (Heckel, 1840) e Carassius auratus (Gunther, 1870) em laboratório.
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Culture of Macrobrachium rosenbergii post-larvae (De Man, 1879) (Crustacea, Palaemonidae) with the fingerlings of Pterophyllum scalare (Heckel, 1840) (Cichlidae) and Carassius auratus (Günther, 1870) (Ciprinidae) in laboratory

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Recursos Pesqueiros e Engenharia de Pesca

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Pesca, Aqüicultura e Atividades dos Serviços Relacionados Com Estas Atividades

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
RESUMO
Avaliou-se o monocultivo do camarão Macrobrachium rosenbergii (De Man, 1879) e policultivo com os peixes ornamentais japonês, Carassius auratus (Günther, 1870), e acará, Pterophyllum scalare (Heckel, 1840), no Laboratório de Aqüicultura (UFPE), de 01 de junho de 1998 a 19 de janeiro de 1999. A densidade do camarão foi igual em todos os experimentos, vinte pós-larvas (PLs) por aquário (volume = 50 litros, área = 0,125 m2), enquanto as dos peixes variaram. No experimento I as densidades do acará foram dois, quatro, seis e oito, com vinte PLs de camarão e um peixe-japonês, nos tratamentos A, B, C e D, respectivamente. No experimento II as do peixe-japonês foram um, dois, três e quatro, com vinte PLs e oito acarás nos tratamentos A, B, C e D, respectivamente. No experimento III foram realizados seis tratamentos: A- vinte camarões, B- um peixe-japonês, C- oito acarás, D- vinte camarões e um peixe-japonês, E- vinte camarões e oito acarás e F- um peixe-japonês e oito acarás. O delineamento experimental foi inteiramente casualizado com quatro repetições. Quinzenalmente as pós-larvas eram pesadas e os peixes medidos, e, avaliada a sobrevivência. As variáveis analisadas não foram significativamente diferentes entre os tratamentos dos experimentos I e II, apenas no III a sobrevivência e o comprimento final apresentaram diferenças entre os tratamentos com acarás, mas não entre os tratamentos com peixe-japonês. O policultivo do camarão com os peixes ornamentais foi considerado viável, recomendando-se as densidades de vinte PLs de M. rosenbergii, oito P. scalare e um C. auratus.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
ABSTRACT
Three experiments were tested with monoculture and polyculture of Macrobrachium rosenbergii post-larvae and fingerlinsg of Pterophyllum scalare and Carassius auratus in Aquaculture Laboratory (UFPE) from June 1st, 1998 to January 19th, 1999. Macrobrachium rosenbergii density was the same in experiments, twenty post-larvae per aquarium (volume = 50 liters, area = 0.125 m2), while angelfish and goldfish densities were different in each experiment. In experiment I the angelfish densities were: two, four, six and eight angelfish with twenty prawns and one goldfish in treatments A, B, C and D, respectively. In experiment II densities of goldfish were: one, two, three and four goldfish with twenty prawns and eight angelfish in treatments A, B, C and D, respectively. Six treatments were done in experiment III: A- twenty prawn, B- one goldfish, C- eight angelfish, D- twenty prawns and one goldfish, E- twenty prawns and eight angelfish and F- one goldfish and eight angelfish. The experimental design was entirely randomized with four replications for each treatment in all experiments. The fingerlings and post-larvae prawns were weighed and measured every fifteen days and at the end of the experiments their final survival was recorded. The experiment I and II did not show significant difference between treatments, but final survival and length showed significant difference between treatments with angelfish, but not between treatments with goldfish. The results showed the possibility of polyculture of ornamental fish goldfish and angelfish with the prawn M. rosenbergii, in densities of twenty post-larvae of M. rosenbergii, eight P. scalare and one C. auratus.
